Gerrymander.definition: the act or method of gerrymandering 2
Gerrymander.origin: [Elbridge Gerry (1744-1814) + sala mander; from the shape of an election district formed during Gerry's governorship of Massachusetts]

1.definition: to divide (a territorial unit) into election districts to give one political party an electoral majority in a large number of districts while concentrating the voting strength of the opposition in as few districts as possible

2.definition: to divide (an area) into political units to give special advantages to one group [ a school district]
